document.masterDocTitle: A review of Tachardiobius (Hymenoptera: Encyrtidae), with description of a new species from California, USA, a parasitoid of Tachardiella spp. (Hemiptera: Kerriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Tachardiobius (Hymenoptera: Encyrtidae), with description of a new species from California, USA, a parasitoid of Tachardiella spp. (Hemiptera: Kerriidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Timberlake
bibRefCitation.refString: Timberlake, P. H. (1926) Miscellaneous new chalcid-flies of the hymenopterous family Encyrtidae. Proceedings of the United States National Museum, 69 (2629), 1 - 34.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Arlington, Maricopa Co., Arizona, USA .

Type material examined.
Paratypes :
3 females
,
1 male
on points and
1 female
on slide [ UCRC ], labeled: 1 . “Reared from
Tachardia larreae
5 Apr. 1919
”; 2 . “Arlington Ariz.”; 3 . “Collected on Greasewood
23 Jan. 1919
”; 4 . “C. H. Gable Collector”; 5 . “Reared by C. S. Menagh”; 6 . “ Paratype ”.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–5.
Tachardiobius nigricans
, female (Riverside County, California, USA). 1. Antenna. 2. Head (rear view). 3. Middle leg. 4. Mesosoma and metasoma. 5. Forewing.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 6–8.
Tachardiobius nigricans
, male (Riverside County, California, USA). 6. Antenna. 7. Forewing. 8. Genitalia.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Mexico (Baja California Sur) and USA (Arizona, California, and Texas [new record]).

Hosts.
Tachardiella larreae (Comstock) (
Timberlake 1926
)
,
Tachardiella
sp(p)., and unidentified Kerriidae .

Comments. The holotype female of
T. nigricans
is deposited in USNM (
Timberlake 1926
); most of the paratypes (including the allotype male) are also in USNM .
